config.question: What motivated the rapid mechanization of industry and agriculture in nineteenth-century North America?

choices.content: a shortage of cheap labor to staff factories and farms
competition from European goods entering America
the desire to build a technologically advanced army
the need to offload unskilled members of the workforce

answer_3.response: The incentive to mechanize northern industry and agriculture came in part from a shortage of cheap labor. Compared to the industrializing nations of Europe, the economy of the United States in the early nineteenth century was labor-scarce.
